meanings.definition: A place where coffee is served and consumed.
meanings.sent1: I love meeting my friends at the coffeehouse for a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent2: The coffeehouse down the street has the best espresso in town.
meanings.sent3: The coffeehouse was so busy that I had to wait in line for my latte.
meanings.sent4: The cozy coffeehouse felt like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled the coffeehouse, inviting me in.

meanings.definition: A social gathering place where coffee is the main beverage served.
meanings.sent1: The coffeehouse is where we all gather to chat and enjoy a cup of coffee.
meanings.sent2: Every Friday evening, the coffeehouse becomes a lively hub of conversations.
meanings.sent3: We turned the coffeehouse into a mini dance party with our energetic moves.
meanings.sent4: In that coffeehouse, coffee was not just a drink but a symbol of togetherness.
meanings.sent5: The coffeehouse buzzed with laughter and shared stories, creating a warm atmosphere.

meanings.definition: An establishment that primarily serves coffee and light refreshments.
meanings.sent1: The coffeehouse on the corner offers delicious pastries along with their coffee.
meanings.sent2: I like to grab a quick snack at the coffeehouse before heading to work.
meanings.sent3: The coffeehouse had a cute display of cookies that tempted me to buy one.
meanings.sent4: The coffeehouse's menu featured a variety of coffees and teas to choose from.
meanings.sent5: The inviting aroma of baked goods welcomed customers into the coffeehouse.
